tunnel_method.title: SSH Tunnel Method
tunnel_method.description: Whether to initiate an SSH tunnel before connecting to the database, and if so, which kind of authentication to use.
No ssh tunnel needed to connect to database
Connect through a jump server tunnel host using username and ssh key

tunnel_host.title: SSH Tunnel Jump Server Host
tunnel_host.description: Hostname of the jump server host that allows inbound ssh tunnel.

tunnel_ssh_port.title: SSH Connection Port
tunnel_ssh_port.description: Port on the proxy/jump server that accepts inbound ssh connections.

tunnel_username.title: SSH Login Username
tunnel_username.description: OS-level username for logging into the jump server host.

tunnel_usersshkey.title: SSH Private Key
tunnel_usersshkey.description: OS-level user account ssh key credentials for logging into the jump server host.

tunnel_db_remote_host.title: Remote Database Host
tunnel_db_remote_host.description: Hostname or static IP address of the database to port-forward, as recognized from the jump server.

tunnel_db_remote_port.title: Remote Database Port
tunnel_db_remote_port.description: Port on the database to port-forward, typically that database's usual default port.

tunnel_localport.title: SSH Tunnel Database Port
tunnel_localport.description: Port on the jump server host for the database's port to forward to. Do not share a port between database instances.

replication_method.title: Replication Method
replication_method.description: Replication method to use for extracting data from the database.

oneOf.title: Standard
oneOf.description: Standard replication requires no setup on the DB side but will not be able to represent deletions incrementally.

oneOf.title: Logical Replication (CDC)
oneOf.description: Logical replication uses the Postgres write-ahead log (WAL) to detect inserts, updates, and deletes. This needs to be configured on the source database itself. Only available on Postgres 10 and above. Read the Postgres Source docs for more information.

publication.description: A Postgres publication used for consuming changes.
